com.pump.swing

Class TransitionTabbedPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JTabbedPane
            • com.pump.swing.TransitionTabbedPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class TransitionTabbedPane
extends javax.swing.JTabbedPane
    This is a JTabbedPane that applies a transition every time the selected tab changes.

    By default this uses a wipe transition, but any Transition2D can be applied if you override the getTransition2D() method.

    Implementation

    Each time a new component is added to this tabbed pane, it is enveloped in a special container. This container overrides its paint() method, so when a transition should be applied only that transition is painted. However, because it is only a container: MouseEvents will always be delegated directly to the components (even though they may not appear in their "real" location until the transition finishes).

    The special envelope container will be returned if you call:
    myTabs.getComponentAt(index)
    So if you use this method to traverse your GUI, you should be aware that the components you directly added aren't returned here in their original form. But this is not a typical call for programmers to make, so I don't think this will be a major problem.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getTransition2D

        protected Transition2D getTransition2D(int prevSelectedIndex,
                                       int newSelectedIndex)
        This returns a wipe transition.

        The wipe moves to the left if the old index is less than the new index, or right otherwise.

        Subclasses can override this method to implement their own transitions.

        Parameters:
        prevSelectedIndex - the initial index.
        newSelectedIndex - the new/current index.
        Returns:
        the transition to be used to go from one index to another.
